website_summaries.verdict: We especially like the fast drying time and the silky smooth finished texture of this paint. Ideal for shabby chic furniture renovations.
pros: Does not require sanding or priming
Virtually odor free with no harsh chemicals
Compares favorably with "high-end" Annie Sloan chalk paint
cons: Mixing and application process can be challenging
Requires several coats for maximum coverage

customer_reviews.title: Love this paint!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently just finished my Oak kitchen cabinets with Renaissance Chalk Paint in Old Linen. I had done lots of research and decided to try this product and so happy that I did! I did not want a super white color and Old Linen was exactly what I was looking for. I'm so ready to try more projects with this paint! Also Renaissance Paint was very responsive to any questions/inquiries I had. Great customer service! Brightened my kitchen up so much and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: This is by far my favorite so far
customer_reviews.text: I paint lots of furniture and have tried many kids of chalk paint. This is by far my favorite so far.. I love the consistency and coverage. No bad smells and easy to distress. Will be ordering more colors!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hollback

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: AAA love this product ...here are before and after pics of my kitchen and a china cabinet that I have redone.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Ashcroft

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic paint! Makes me want to paint everything
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic paint! Makes me want to paint everything... Easy to use, dries fast, goes on super even, and no smell what so ever. Ordered another can.
customer_reviews.author: RMel

customer_reviews.title: The best paint ever
customer_reviews.text: Let me first start off saying the kit is well worth it...I ordered it so I could change the color of my island and at first I was going to paint the whole thing...but once I painted and waxed the top the island looked perfect...so I'm adding before and after pics...and this was my first time ever using chalk paint and wax. .I will definitely order again and a little goes a long way....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! I redid all my kitchen cabinets in old linen. The paint is fantastic only needs 2 coats. Finished with the clear wax and antiqued with the dark wax. I was so confused and did a lot of research and I am very happy I sealed with the was even though I do a lot of cooking....the cabinets clean up beautifully with mild cleanser. Highly recommend it!! Before and After pics
customer_reviews.author: Paul Prinzivalli

customer_reviews.title: Get this paint
customer_reviews.text: I love this paint. Goes on smooth and easy. Looks beautiful. I used dark wax on it and it is beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri in Kent

customer_reviews.title: I'd definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Our first time painting big furniture. 1 can, 2 coats covered 1 dresser, 1 coffee table, and a table lamp. We were very impressed with the quality of this product. Fast drying time and zero smells. We didn't prime any of the furnitures - we only cleaned it with a towel before starting. We waxed it with the Renaissance clear wax after the second coat dried. I'd definitely recommend this product. I've added some before and after pictures for reference!
customer_reviews.author: rbn12

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Pink, great quality paint
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t find a magenta locally so naturally, I turned to Amazon. I found this beautiful, rich pink color called Cerise and knew I found “the one”. It took less than a quart to cover all my kitchen cabinets with two coats. Then I sealed it all with clear wax and then I added demension with dark wax. (Without the dark wax- this was a bubblegum pink.)
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: I love this chalk paint! This is my first time using chalk paint and I am glad I came across this one instead of traveling 45 min to the nearest Annie Sloan stockist. I only needed two coats - the second one i diluted with water and still, GREAT coverage! I will definitely be buying more in the future. I applied with a Purdy soft bristle brush.
customer_reviews.author: KristenAlexis

customer_reviews.title: Love this chalk paint!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this through Amazon's Madame Gigi's Cottage Seller. They were so helpful. I transformed cherry cabinets and modernized them using Gothic Gray Renaissance Chalk paint. It only took this small can to paint my center island. I painted my other two areas Ivory, making it a great contrast. Already receiving compliments. Ivory cabinets are the after/Orange Cherry is the before. I plan on using Renaissance Chalk paint on other projects.
customer_reviews.author: G. R. Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I used this paint for the first time to refinish a Chippendale style lowboy. I really like it! The coverage was great and the color was deliciously creamy. It adhered beautifully, even when I taped off the freshly painted finish to stain the top. I was nervous peeling away the tape but the paint didn't flake off at all. I will definitely use Renaissance Chalk paint again!
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing dining room makeover !
customer_reviews.text: This paint is awesome! I painted my 90s oak dining table and old stenciled oak buffet with the black color. The wax really gives it a nice toned down sheen. I'm so happy with my "new" dining room. (The chairs are new). Both of these pieces were painted with a couple of coats with this one quart of paint.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen M

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. I had such high hopes for this chalk paint but it did not meet expectations. I bought this paint to paint my trims in my bathroom. This paint does not cover properly, despite several coats. Almost like it was sliding. The coverage is very uneven. Granted, maybe after a few coats it may work, however that’s way too much work. This paint is too expensive for what it offers. I decided to use my waverly paint from Walmart and it coated evenly within a coat. With another coat it will be coated to my liking. Way better product. Attached are photos to see the difference. I’m glad I didn’t use this paint for my furniture restorations.
customer_reviews.author: I_love_owls

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product and outstanding customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I have now used this paint for a desk, a bed, a hutch, and most recently, an entire kitchen. It's easy to use and the fact that they can match any color from Sherwin Williams and Benjamin Moore is icing on the cake. I have had questions and they are always quick to respond with helpful tips. I can't say enough how much I love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Substandard This Time Around
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this product several times before. The last two orders took unusually long, and one of those two took ridiculously long, even for Covid standards. To add insult to injury, the paint quality was horrible, which was unusual for this brand. The paint was very drippy and thin, with very minimal coverage. Numerous coats required. The above description is actually the complete opposite of the customary paint thickness and quality. I will never order this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a pro did it!
customer_reviews.text: This paint was easy to use and looks awesome. I used the Celadonite...I was afraid that it was going to look green, but it doesn't at all. It is a very nice light turquoise blue. I used the dark and clear waxes as well because the piece I was painting had details I really wanted to show. In all it took me two long evenings to finish my piece, and it is beautiful! I've gotten so many compliments on it. I plan to order the ivory to use on another piece of furniture. I would definitely recommend this paint.
customer_reviews.author: A. Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Paint!
customer_reviews.text: Since discovering Renaissance chalk paints in Amazon, I've ordered multiple colors for my hobby of refinishing furniture for the old farmhouse my hubby and I are renovating. Every color I've used is beautiful and goes on smooth and covers in two coats or less. One quart of Old Linen stretched through our dining room table, four chairs, a bench and our coffee table; two coats apiece. I've done a dresser in Black Indigo and an accent table in Vermilion Red. I also use both the clear and dark wax to finish my pieces and I love them too! I can't recommend these paints enough.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Myers

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: We refinish furniture often and I have wanted to try out chalk paint for awhile. We used this to refinish two side tables and a dresser. We scrubbed and scuff sanded the tables and dresser before painting. The coverage was good. It needed a light second coat of paint. At the same time we refinished another part of the side tables with Sherwin Williams Solo paint (the blue) (also only scuff sanding). The Sherwin Williams paint came out smoother and didn't leave brush strokes like the chalk paint. All in all, I'm not completely sold on chalk paint, but for the price, I think it is effective and close in quality. On a budget, I would use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice coverage even mixed with water
customer_reviews.text: Love this paint! I used it to "greywash" my fireplace, which is fake brick (it's really painted cement, not brick). I bought one pint of alabaster and mixed it with one pint of water. It was just barely enough to do the brick face but not enough to do the grout too. I bought another pint (same deal mixed it with water) and went back over the grout. It did a nice job of covering the dark brown paint of the brick and the yellowing "grout". Posting pics.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Love Crafts
customer_reviews.text: Just used this paint and I love it! Used French Beige and finished it with Black Wax...Love my new TV stand!!!
customer_reviews.author: BabyBlue

customer_reviews.title: Love this color!
customer_reviews.text: Overall love this color and paint! Went on pretty smooth, but not very self leveling. Could definitely see brush strokes, especially after adding the clear wax in the last two pictures. It’s in a darker area of the room, so not noticeable.. would be more noticeable near a window/sunlight. I do love the change of the nightstand though, and purchased newer brass hardware to replace the ones in the pic. The wax really brought out the richness of the green and made the piece. I used a clear wax from BB frosch.. also purchased on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MomTo2

customer_reviews.title: I love this paint!
customer_reviews.text: Since I couldn't go to the hardware store, I ordered online. I was very skeptical, as I'd never done it before. The paint arrive packed well with additional clips on the lid to insure nonspill travel. There was a coupon for my next order ( there definitely Will be!) also info on where to find informational videos. I've redone several pieces of furniture over the past 10 years and I'm telling you- this paint is a DREAM. One coat covered, two just for extra coverage. (it's in the kitchen.) No odor, easy cleanup. I'm in NO WAY affiliated with the company who makes this paint, but I will definitely be purchasing again!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Fine quality, color not quite what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: A dusty blue color that brightens in sunlight and looks less great in yellow tone residential lighting. If this company is listening... here’s an innovation to consider. Show multiple swatches: original color, the color in cool (white/blue) light - commonly office lighting, the color in natural sunlight, and the color in warm (yellow/red) light - commonly residential lighting. Help us understand the color — at least generally— as it will be in the reality of the room‘s daily life. No problem with the paint, seems like standard quality stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Auliya

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Value, works just as well if not better than Annie Sloan Paints. Great Price. Will order again.
customer_reviews.author: HKneisley

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: love love love! Did my bathroom cabinets to look like an old sunken treasure chest and this greenish color with the black wax looks amazinggggg! At first before the wax i was scared it would be too lite. But no it made it look old and truly what I was going for. I love it. And I put 4 coats on my entire cabinet (could have stopped at 2.) And still have so much paint left. It is thin and really truly goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: tristin m.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, needs better instructions...
customer_reviews.text: Great product overall, I was very impressed. The directions/instructions were VERY lacking....but I was able to find several videos online and work it out. Essentially what I did: Quick/light sanding of the wood (300grit). I used 409 to clean off the wood and dried it. Then I applied 4-5 coats on the wood with the chalk paint. After that I used the clear wax and used some generous coats. I came back an hour later and buffed it again with a cloth. Then I used the black wax to age it. The black wax really leaves a mark....a little bit really goes a long way...do don't overdo it. After about 24hrs it was fully dry and good to use.
customer_reviews.author: C James

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this was a great paint. The color was not as rich as shown, a bit more towards the hunter side than the dark emerald green it appears. I had now way to make it that rich emerald color but I happened to have a lighter, bright green that I mixed in and came up with a more desirable color for my project.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Sears

customer_reviews.title: Wax is definitely key!
customer_reviews.text: I used this chalk paint to cover up an old desk I had. It was dark wood and glossy. It took 3 coats to fully cover the way I wanted. I wasn’t sure if I wanted a wax finish or not but, quickly learned that it was needed after placing items on the desk and paint coming up when an item was placed on it. So after touching up the paint, I used a wax and it turned out really nice! Still trying to figure out if it was worth a two step process vs painting with normal paint that has a primer in it.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Ruined my furniture
customer_reviews.text: First off I got the color wrong with this. I wanted a light grey for my kitchen table but this was white almost but begrudgingly I continued. I was told no prep was needed for chalk paint so I slapped three coats on & sealed with polycrylic. Well a couple days later paint has chipped & it’s ugly yellow stains on the table. So now I’m going to have to buy another table cause it bothers me. But hay lesson leaned don’t know if this just happens with this color but definitely not a pleasant experience.Also did my daughters bed and the same ugly yellow streaks have appeared! Waste of money and furniture ruined!!️
customer_reviews.author: August H.

customer_reviews.title: Zero coverage. Look like you put yogurt instead of paint, need 3 coats to get some coverage :-( .
customer_reviews.text: This paint is so light that’s look like you just spread yogurt on your piece of furniture. If you are used to thick chalk paint to do your project this is not the paint for you . I’m currently working on a little desk I got for my daughter Ana I want it to paint it pink and add some rise butterflies stencil on it . Terrible to being with. I’m looking at this desk and I’m like I will need 6 layers to get a decent color . No way . You will need to sand ,use primer and the whole nine yards. Definitely going back to my Rust-Oleum chalk paint to fix this mess .
customer_reviews.author: Gabysil77

customer_reviews.title: Love!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this paint with intentions of painting a dresser but decided to use it on the dresser and to paint 2 of these velvet chairs that were in terrible condition & bright pink. This paint looks so good on the dresser and also the chairs. If you are painting velvet furniture this is by far the best quality. It doesn’t bleed onto other things - white pillows, blankets, clothes, ext. I have had this issue before but not with this brand. Highly recommend! And they have a really wide variety of colors. Colors are true to the color sample page!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Garantine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, ordered a 2nd gallon
customer_reviews.text: Awesome paint, its a very thick consistency so that two coats will be more than enough. I redid my kitchen and bathroom vanity after buying 1 gal of the arabian espresso. They came out amazing. I did have to order another gallon to finish up my kitchen but i will have plenty left over for future projects. I do reccomend using a clear coat after applying the paint to give it extra protection, also i hate the chalky feeling (just my opinion tho).
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Ah, chalk paint
customer_reviews.text: The paint was a beautiful rich color. While refinishing a desk, I had to use three coats on unsanded parts, which used up a lot of product, even though I primed first. I patched some gouges on the desk top and sanded very well. I was unable to remove some deep water damage, but did not prime before painting. The water damage bled through one coat of paint, so I'll have to start over on that part. I like the product and would buy again and recommend with a caveat that you'll probably need more than you estimate when beginning your project.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this paint!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using chalk paint, and let me tell you it was so easy. I painted my bedroom set from black to white with this paint and it was so easy. I only needed one and a half cans for everything. I am talking about 2 night stands, 1 dresser a bed and 1 chest. And I had to do two coats bc I was going from dark to light. Love this paint I will definitely be using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Heba A

customer_reviews.title: It completely wiped off!
customer_reviews.text: I am referring to the paint, not the kit. I really like the color. I spent some time masking off a cabinet, and painting, which took 2 coats. It is much thinner than Sloane's, if you are wondering. Today I was ready to wax it, and all the paint just wiped off! After all that work! It has been sitting for two days too, so obviously, it was very dry! I am so upset. This is really expensive paint, and I am 3 days too late in asking for a refund, as I didn't start my project the same week I got this. if you get this paint, test it first!
customer_reviews.author: Sanssouci572

customer_reviews.title: Snow colored Chalk paint
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience purchasing chalk paint (I usually make my own) It was a little more difficult for me to get a smooth finish without sanding. I used the entire 32oz on a small twin bed with slated head and foot board. It didn't seem to have the best coverage for me .I did 4 coats and then sanded between coats to get the finish I wanted. I have been using chalk paint for 6 years on pretty much all my diy projects and ihave never used so much paint for 1 frame. This would be ideal for someone who wants more of a really rustic brush stroked look to their furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Neeners503

customer_reviews.title: Love the color. Not great coverage.
customer_reviews.text: I love the color. Love it. I didn’t like the paint so much. When I was painting my dresser, I had to do two coats as the coverage wasn’t so hot. Not a problem because there was a very dark color I was covering. Then when applying the second coat, the paint would “lift” and peel away the first coat. I have never had this happen. I used a very cheap chalk paint on my other projects and was hoping this one would look better and a bit smoother. It did but it was really hard to get the second coat to go over the first without lifting the paint completely off the dresser.
customer_reviews.author: Diana D.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The paint is a very Flat color
customer_reviews.text: I used this to paint the inside of a bookcase to cheer up my living room with a light green color. It was easy to apply. I did not like the "flat color that in my case looked like a "green chalkboard". I spent extra money for the wax to shine it up a bit and to make it more durable. The wax was an extra expense. I still did not like the look and in my case, the wax did not even help the durability. I ended up going to the hardware store and buying new interior paint. Some love this kind of paint but I like the good 0ld- Fashioned interior paint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frozen Paint
customer_reviews.text: I received the paint in 2 days via Prime. Once I shook the can vigorously per the instructions and opened it, I immediately noticed chunks of something floating around. After reading the back of the can, I understand this to be caused by the paint freezing (below 50 degrees) at some point during shipment. The can states that this will NEVER reconstitute and that I should contact Retiqueit.net- which I have. This is completely upsetting because I needed to finish this project before next weekend as a birthday gift and now I'm not even sure how to get another can of paint. This gallon wasnt cheap by any means!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Barragan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful paint that can transform any piece of furniture into a treasure.
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed with this brand. I have used Other brands and never got a beautiful finish like Retique it Chalk Paint. We were gifted an old piano and I decided to paint it. I looked at the Magnolia Chalk Paint line and they wanted over $100 and $50 shipping for a quart of paint. I’m so glad I found this brand on Amazon. It’s such a great deal for the whole kit. I used two coats of the paint and then I did three coats of the polyacrylic, sanding lightly between each coat. I am so happy with the result. I used the color French Beige.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy A.

customer_reviews.title: perfection!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Loved it so much, ended up doing entire kitchen (bought originally just for small guest bathroom cabinets)! We bought the gypsum color, and used dark wax on top.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a "no prep" paint
customer_reviews.text: This is my project after 2 coats of retique snow colored paint. You could see every brush stroke. I wasted a day putting 2 coats on 3 chairs and my table only to have to go back and sand it all off (which is what I wanted to avoid doing in the first place, sanding) and go a different route. If I had a spot on my chair that had maybe dirt or oil it pulled it to the surface and dried very discolored. Very disappointed, this kit is crazy expensive for the quality. I will be reaching out to the company to try and get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda V

customer_reviews.title: I was quickly disappointed when I actually tried using it
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this color in person I was thrilled. I was quickly disappointed when I actually tried using it. No matter what I tried, the paint would not spread evenly. I tried it on different types of wood and nothing. Even on a virgin plan of wood you could see streaks of dark and light. It creates a pretty effect though like this but if it's not what you were going for there's no fixing it. I ended up using half the bottle trying to apply more coats to fix it and now I've ruined a perfectly good piece of furniture. I'm more frustrated because this is very expensive paint too.
customer_reviews.author: Karina Isabel Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Good value starter kit.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the deluxe starter kit in "Robin's Egg" to begin my furniture refurbishing adventure. The kit included gloves, a cloth, dark and light wax, a can of paint, and a paint brush and a waxing brush. The paint went on smoothly and easily and had almost no odour. A little went a long way with the paint, and I have 3/4 of a can left after painting a couple of coats on a medium sized table. The clear wax stunk to high heaven but was easy enough to use. I needed almost the entire can of clear wax to finish the table, but it provided a nice sheen and seal. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vicktoria

customer_reviews.title: For my first experience with chalk paint this was wonderful! The color is exactly what I hoped it ...
customer_reviews.text: For my first experience with chalk paint this was wonderful! The color is exactly what I hoped it would be when dry. This paint covered an old, red oak dry sink that was very thirsty in only 2 coats as well as a dining room table and dresser turned server for a dining room. The coverage is excellent and I was surprised how little paint was needed for each item. Though it seemed a bit pricey, I now realize it was worth the cost. So excited to finally have my french country dining room furniture for minimal cost....always more satisfying to do the work and see the end result as opposed to buying new furniture!
customer_reviews.author: Gina G.

customer_reviews.title: Best Chalkpaint I have found!
customer_reviews.text: Best Chalk Paint I have found! Great coverage! And a large quantity! I did use a white primer on the fireplace before. The stove heater was black and only required 1 coat. Distressed with Waverly Antique Wax then sealed with Beeswax. The end tables I gave 2 coats. Sealed with Beeswax. I painted so many things we joked that our Great Dane/Coonhound was going to be turned into a Great Pyrenees if he stayed still long enough! I plan on ordering other colors.
customer_reviews.author: HoneyBee

customer_reviews.title: Customer service amazing #free returns
customer_reviews.text: I bought two different colors by accident and the company gave me a free return label to return the mistaken order for free. They are hassle-free with amazing customer service. With that being said it looks soo much better in person & soo professional, You won't regret buying this. In fact, I am buying more paint to match the colors to other furniture and make a set. P.S. this was my first time painting furniture myself.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal honest buyer

customer_reviews.title: Now I know
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to use, first time using chalk paint. No sanding at all. No prep other than a wipe down from dust. My big complaint is to me, it looks lighter than pictured, even after a few coats. Could be my eyes or even my monitor. I'm happy enough with it for now. But will most likely look for a darker purple down the road. It's more pinkish purple. Shown with it is the renaissance black. Sealed with wax but will use poly next time for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in coverage
customer_reviews.text: I refinished an old dresser and I do like that the paint was easy to work with but even after all the research that I did I am disappointed that I will need to purchase an additional quart to cover the natural unstained oak. It states that you don’t need to sand or strip the furniture but I had already done that before I decided on this paint. The paint has soaked in and even after 5 coats I can see the wood showing through! I did not water it down.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband refinishes furniture and would never consider not sanding and stripping. I hated our oak powder room cupboard and decided to surprise him with a painted cupboard. The worse that could happen was he would have to strip and sand the cupboard. He had to go out of town for a class and I went to work. I'll be honest I was terrified I was going to have a mess. The cupboard looks brand new and exactly the same color gray as you see on the home shows. Don't hesitate to try this brand. Don't hesitate to paint a cupboard. You will be thrilled with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Smith

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color, but coverage isn’t as good as competitors
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful color, but coverage isn’t as good as competitors. Used 3 coats and could have used more. For the price, I would have expected better quality coverage. This is one dresser I did. One quart aloud me to paint one dresser and one king size bed frame. Used a wet distress technique and was satisfied with results. My only issue was the amount of paint I had to use for proper coverage. Will need another quart for the remaining pieces
customer_reviews.author: Mark Burrage

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage
customer_reviews.text: I love this paint!!! I refinished a small side table with this. I did sand it which it said you didnt have to but i did. The table had water damage on the top so there was some bubbling. I sanded as much as i could but it was still there. After applying 2 coats you seriously can not even tell there is a bubble. Its beautiful and wonderful texture. I got the indigo black. Highly recommend and will purchase more for future projects!!
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as I’d have hoped
customer_reviews.text: Alabaster is a beautiful color, more beige than gray. It took 2-3 coats over primer to cover fully on my kitchen and bathroom cabinets. I also did two layers of polycyclic over them to protect the finish. It’s been about a month and has already had some chipping in higher traffic places in both rooms so I’m a bit bummed about the durability of the paint considering the price but still totally smitten with the color.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Thacher

customer_reviews.title: It is okay....not great.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Annie Sloan chalk paint before. I thought I would give this a try. It is okay but it does not give the coverage like AS paint. It is not as creamy and therefore does not go on as smooth. I am painting a small round table and four chairs. Am having to put on two coats versus one coat with AS paint. Will see how durable it is after I have waxed all the pieces. Next time I will buy AS paint even though it is more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Helen L.

customer_reviews.title: Way too thick
customer_reviews.text: Okay - I wanted to love it but I just couldn't. I bought Queen's Wreath thinking it was going to be a darker gray/purple color. It should have been named Disney Princess Lavender. The color on the can even showed a darker gray/purple so it wasn't my screen. It's really thick and dries VERY quickly. It also leaves kind of a gritty texture like there's something not quite right with the formula. This was my 4th chalk painted piece so I know what the texture should have ended up like and I was sure to mix it well before each coat. I ended up sanding the piece down and using another brand. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Awesome paint!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this paint to paint my 35 year old bathroom vanity. It covered the vanity beautifully. There was virtually no fumes and the paint also did not drip everywhere. I purchased only a pint and I only used about 1/4 of the can for a small vanity. Highly recommended. I will be buying this in more colors for other projects around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this product! It is my first time painting a piece of furniture. It was so much fun and we absolutely Love the outcome! It was easy to use, had no fumes and looks amazing. I look forward to doing my next piece of furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Ammie

customer_reviews.title: Good chalk paint, color doesn't match the picture.
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping for more of an eggplant purple, and per the picture I thought that's what I was going to get. I painted a desk and the color I got was much lighter and brighter. You can see in the picture the drawers are the color it came out. The paint was easy to use and covers great, like most chalk paints. I'd buy from them again, just without expectations of the true color I'm getting.
customer_reviews.author: YENSINA MARINARO

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR A WESTERN THEME!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, doesn’t smell at all. Make sure to buy the top coat otherwise it scratches very easy (like chalk lol). I painted all my daughters furniture and even some extra decor and I LOVE it. True color is like 1st photo!
customer_reviews.author: Kassandra

customer_reviews.title: Make sure all product is in your box before starting
customer_reviews.text: The large brush wasn’t included in my shipment. I had to use a different brush (a cheaper one that I had on hand) and wound up placing 3 coats on my desk due to visible brush strokes. Since I had to put 3 coats on it, it used up the entire can of paint. I should of had enough to paint my desk and dresser. Not thrilled since this paint is expensive. Still in the process of waxing. So far, I like it (other than using the entire can of paint). Can’t wait to use the dark wax!
customer_reviews.author: Working Mom

customer_reviews.title: Painting chairs with chalk paint
customer_reviews.text: This was my first chalk paint experience and my projects came out great. The paint does get thick quickly , but was easily remedied with a few spoons of hot water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL PAINT
customer_reviews.text: I got this to redo a dry sink that I have. It was dark wood before, so it took about 3 coats to have no show through(I was painting thin coats). And there is still at least 3/4 of the paint left, so it goes a long way. I used the special paintbrush that is designed for chalk paint and it turned out absolutely beautiful. I was very satisfied with this paint and the results. Seems like they have a lot of colors to choose from as well. Will be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Hatch

customer_reviews.title: I did not like this paint
customer_reviews.text: This paint is too thin and requires too many coats for coverage. Other chalk paint is thicker and covers better. I bought this for the variety of colors and I do like the pink color I purchased. I just don't like the paint itself. And it was very expensive. Had it worked better, I would have gladly paid the price, but with how poorly it covered, I feel it is too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Lounsberry

customer_reviews.title: This made me feel talented!
customer_reviews.text: I have redone two large dressers with this kit and could not be more thrilled. The video is helpful if you’ve never done a project like this. It took me 4-5 hours per dresser. The paint has no fumes, the wax does. Be mindful of ventilation as you prepare to start. I used mineral spirits to clean the wax brushes and bought extra gloves for the second project. Other than that, the kit provides everything!! I have half a can of remaining paint, and over half of the dark wax left. I used all of the clear wax and ended up using a t-shirt for the wax application on the second project. You won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite chalk paint.
customer_reviews.text: Great chalk paint. I have used many brands. I have made my own. This has a great consistency, wonderful coverage, great color selection. I painted one dresser with six drawers, two coats, and used about 1/4 of a quart. I use a good quality purdy or Wooster brush. Cleans up easy with soap and water. I have nothing bad to say about this. From price point, I don’t think this is over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Bennett Scott

customer_reviews.title: ... Chalk Paint for a few projects and I really like it! I recently remodeled a hutch and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used Renaissance Chalk Paint for a few projects and I really like it! I recently remodeled a hutch and the color came out perfectly! This paint was a bit thicker then other colors I have used in the past but other than that I loved using the paint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kit is good but...
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. The paint is easy to apply. The round brush is good for waxing but not necessary. The flat brushes are ordinary brushes you can pick up at home depot. The dark wax I didn't like but that's a personal choice. All in all, I would just by the paint and clear wax separately and not buy the kit. And by the way... I was very surprised when the invoice inside the box stated the Unit cost to be $68.00. since I was charged $85 plus tax A bit of a Rip Off....just so you know!
customer_reviews.author: franki

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the same as the others
customer_reviews.text: I have used at least 4 other brands of chalk paint. I was very excited to try this brand as they have so many colors. I was a little disappointed. This paint was so much thinner! It would work great for someone who likes to dry brush or do a wash method of painting, but if you want really good one coat coverage, this may not be for you. I don't think it was quite as matte as other chalk paints either. That being said, the color was nice and dry time was fast.
customer_reviews.author: K. D

customer_reviews.title: The best chalk paint I’ve found so far.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, we all know chalk paint isn’t cheap and Renaissance is no exception but I liked this much better than the other brands I’ve used. I The other brands are often too thick and therefore show brush strokes. Renaissance has the same consistency as regular paint and self-levels beautifully. The brushes in the kit are very high quality brushes and the wax is smooth and goes on like butter. Even though it was expensive, I feel like it was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: B. Coffman

customer_reviews.title: Rustoleum Paint at home depot was much better
customer_reviews.text: This product was expensive and did not perform well at all. It was not a fun experience to use. I had painted furniture before and found the Rustoleum chalk paint at the local Home Depot much more easy to use. It dried smoother with no lumps or drips as opposed to this product. An once it dried it did not show streaks and it did not wipe off. Don't waste your money or your time.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Millington

customer_reviews.title: I Used it to change bathroom cabinet color
customer_reviews.text: I was going yo change my bathroom cabinet ,But BOy was expensive ,so I decided to give a chance to myself and see if i can change the color ,I saw the same combination and did it , came out beautiful stunning and much prettier than i can imagine there for I kept the money was going to spend on the cabinet for better use . Thank you very much
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful! I used this on a bookshelf, kitchen table, and fireplace. I chose to sand the kitchen table and chairs because I was unsure about the claim, no sanding needed. I didn't even use the entire container for a round table and 4 chairs. I used the remainder for a small 4x4 bookshelf. I loved the results so much I ordered another 32oz container, Ivory Tower, for our fireplace. We have an electric fireplace and I couldn't stand the brown color. I decided to use it without sanding...mainly because I was done sanding things. It went right on. Doesn't peel or flake. I gave it a few coats of clear wax and it looks fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.author: grlnXtdoor

customer_reviews.title: First Time Chalk Paint User
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this paint. I used water like it said to, but I did have to do two coats. The pic shows one coat vs. two. Also, make sure you cover all areas with the wax. If you don’t, the paint will come up if scratched. The final product looked great (can’t figure out how to add more pics) but I definitely utilized the black wax—it came up easily with the clear wax if I didn’t like something. All in all I had a great first experience with this paint.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Why pay more?
customer_reviews.text: I've chalk painted more furniture than I'd like..... however, this stuff works AS GOOD as Annie Sloan. I've redone cheap mahogany furniture, as well as laminate Ikea furniture in this and it was sooooo easy! I know chalk paint purists insist on finishing with wax, but I'm all about ease. Finish with polycrilic (sp) and just wait 24 hours before bringing inside. Poly is the way to go for finishing chalk paint!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great color
customer_reviews.text: I used this little can of paint to paint a 4X10 foot kitchen island. It covered it and had some left. I love the bright green color. One coat over a dark brown color is all it needed. I love it. I used the wax afterwards to seal it and give it a slight shine. I took my time and it took me three days to paint it and three days to apply wax.
customer_reviews.author: tammy

customer_reviews.title: not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I used this to paint a bed frame/headboard and the paint itself is pretty good but the color is not what I was expecting I assumed this paint would look like a true Ivory color but it's more like a cream/yellow color so I will have to find a new color and repaint. So disappointed because this stuff is expensive.
customer_reviews.author: A&GT

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a LOT of different chalk style paints. Good coverage with white shades has always been a problem. I prefer non toxic VOC free paints, and this one did not disappoint! I used it on both of these French provincial pieces, and I’m about to buy another can. I only wish it was more affordable. It sands beautifully in between coats to knock down any brush strokes. I’m excited to try new colors!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Kay

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: This product is so amazing! So easy and fun to do... highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Lobenstein

customer_reviews.title: Chalk pain true to color, works like magic. Just love this product!!!! Fan for life.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is like magic in can. I swear - one can with leftover and I painted a table and 6 chairs!!! Two coats. I've already ordered more!
customer_reviews.author: Mammadukes NJ

customer_reviews.title: Great color but lacks durability
customer_reviews.text: I tried the new shade called black indigo. The color was really gteat but the paint wore off in patches and lacked the durability I had experienced when using chalk style paint previously (a different brand that offers a more limited color palette) It was very disappointing to see this paint wear so badly. I did follow the directions and seal the project, too.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Paneling makeover
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! After a failed attempt to stain knotty wood paneling (not to mention labor intensive sanding, and hazards from dust and fumes), I finally decided there must be a better way. I decided to try to "whitewash" the paneling with this paint. I used old linen mixed with water. In the pic you can see the results - the moulding on top was not painted (I plan to paint it white after painting the drywall above it) so you can see what color the paneling was before. No fumes, no dust or sanding, no stripping!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Love this paint!!!
customer_reviews.text: No odor, easy to use, beautiful color (Camelot blue)! The desk in picture is with two coats of the chalk paint. The small pic is with just chalk paint, large pic is after 2 coats of satin finish varethane. I used varrthane instead of wax because I was working indoors and wanted to avoid the “rubber cement” odor/fumes wax gives off. Love the final product, beautiful and durable upcycle of my grandparents desk!
customer_reviews.author: Taina

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product great coverage.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very light sage green whenever it is finished. The paint itself is very light green almost mint and at first I didnt like it. After I waxed and antiqued the paint I loved how it turned out. It darkened it and gave it the exact color I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Restan

customer_reviews.title: I'm not crafty but this RAWKS!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a good painter and carpenter, but have feared changing an oak chair for fear of having to "refinish" it. This paint and the wax was tons easier than I expected, and tons better looking than I could have hoped for. Clean the furniture with water to remove dust, etc. Paint a couple coats (goes quickly!). Apply wax and wipe with old tee shirt, and VOILA! You've got a gorgeous new piece of furniture. I went from oak to black and it looks like a perfect piece in just a couple hours (since I watched videos on youtube), but second chair more like 3 twenty minute steps to completion!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lewis

customer_reviews.title: First time user.
customer_reviews.text: After priming my cupboards, 3 coats of this paint still weren't enough. The clear wax can had a huge bubble in the wax. The first time I put in the brush, it collapsed showing how little wax was in the can. The wax dried too quickly to even buff it. The dark wax was so dry and would not spread at all. I had streaks. After that dried, I dipped my brush in mineral spirits before applying the dark wax. Only then was I able to spread it.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Love this paint!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about purchasing paint online, but with this I'm glad I did. I took it to my local hardware shop to have shaken and they were happy to do so (at no charge!) as long as the can had never been opened. I used this to refinish a bedroom set. The coverage was great! I used 2 coats of chalk paint, then 1 coat of polycrylic, followed by antiquing finish, then topped off with 2 more coats of polycrylic. My finished product turned out great! Very pleased with this paint! The best part is I have lots leftover to do more projects. I'm thinking of refinishing my kitchen cabinets with it next!
customer_reviews.author: peacock88

customer_reviews.title: Liquid gold!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is liquid gold! It brought my outdated kitchen cabinets and bathroom vanity to life. Old linen is a gorgeous shade, but more than that, it goes on so easily and covers amazingly! The old wood was almost covered with just one coat. I only did two coats to achieve this look. This is my go to chalk paint from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the eco-friendly zero VOC of this product
customer_reviews.text: I love the eco-friendly zero VOC of this product. It was a little gritty even after I shook and stirred it for a WHILE. The grit is not the biggest deal, you can wipe the little pieces off easily. Color is not as pumpkin as I thought. It is a little lighter. But non the less I still like this product. GREAT for furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Money saver
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my original formica countertops in my trailer to make it look like butcher block, stained it and then finished it with a polyurethane finish. It looks like wood, it's fantastic! I'd post a picture but for some reason it won't let me.. Anyway, great product and saved me a ton of money and effort not to replace countertops.
customer_reviews.author: lacerosas

customer_reviews.title: Love this paint
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid to use chalk paint because I had seen in the past some furniture painted with chalk and it seem inconsistent but I read the reviews and I decided to try it and I love the way my cabinets came out the paint was easy to work with very forgiving I would recommend this highly to anybody Even if’s your first time try chalk paint
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful!! This was my first time using chalk paint. I have a 1990's orange oak coffee table and end tables and TV stand. I was going to get rid of them and buy new but thought I'd try this first. I did to tops in a dark espresso urethane stain and used the chalk paint on the legs and they turned out GORGEOUS! I couldn't be happier and it saved me hundreds over buying new furniture. I even used it on my old, pitted, brass lamp bases and it was great. So easy to use and easy cleanup. If you have old furniture, try this before you junk it. I think you'll be amazed.
customer_reviews.author: GreeneyesTN

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this paint at least 4 times. Twice it had no VOC odor, the other 2 times it had high VOC odor. I opened this container today to use and after about 30 minutes, I became very nauseated from the smell. The paint did not spread well with this batch. I am disappointed, it is convenient to order from Amazon but will have to upgrade to CeCe Caldwell for black chalk paint that is consistently odorless.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Antoinette

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to want to paint everything after using this paint!
customer_reviews.text: This paint is amazing!!! I have used other chalk paint before and the paint did not cover well. I was about to give up until I ordered this paint!! I received it saturday and I have already painted two pieces of furniture (and it is now tuesday) and still have more than a half of can left!! I will definitely buy this paint for every thing. I am going to finish my furniture and then I am going to paint my kitchen cabinets!! You will not be disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this paint!
customer_reviews.text: Great paint! Dries fast and easy to distress. Highly recommended! I used the Arabian Coffee color.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent paint!
customer_reviews.text: My dining room table was my very first chalk paint project ever. After reading through reviews I decided to try this brand over Annie Slone brand as it was less expensive and had good reviews. I purchashed a few pints of Dove Grey and it took a can and a half to cover my large table and eight chairs. The color is beautiful and goes on thick the first coat. It took 2 coats to cover very well. I did 3 coats for extra measure along with a waterbased polyurethane satin finish. I recommend using a proper chalk paint brush as it goes on beautifully and even. I will be purchasing more for future projects!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Best blue paint color ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Prettiest blue color ever! Awesome, love it!! I distressed it so it's darker then it was when I put the first and second coat in it.
customer_reviews.author: ShellyArm

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the worst furniture paint ever
customer_reviews.text: I have painted a lot of furniture and used many different brands . I wanted to love this , but this is hands down the absolute worst paint I have ever used . I wouldn’t use it again even if it was free. I hate leaving a bad review but This is awful . And if you use white ... plan to use about 5 coats and then still want to use a different brand . 👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M. Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this paint
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this paint. I won't use anything else again! I used to make my own chalk paint with plaster of paris, but this is so much better. Amazing coverage and great color. BTW-- If you want great coverage, you have to use a great brush! Looks like some people on here say the coverage isn't great, but I did two dressers with one coat of Greystone, and still have tons of paint to spare in from the qt size. (note: we did want some of the undercoat to show through for a shabby, beachy look.) But you have to get a high quality brush for high quality coverage. Feeling very inspired and ready to take on more projects!
customer_reviews.author: MSH

customer_reviews.title: Assistance needed!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this paint. I’m having an issue with white residue being leftover as it dries and I’ve had to apply about 4 coats in hopes that it would stop leaving the residue and it would stop showing the old finish underneath. I’m on my second quart for a decent sized dresser. I had no idea it would take so much paint. Please help. I could really use some solutions to this issue. I was hoping to be done with this project this week.
customer_reviews.author: Rayna

product_meta.title: Retique It Chalk Furniture Paint by Renaissance DIY, 32 oz (Quart), 02 Ivory Tower-Antique White, 32 Fl Oz
product_meta.description: Size Name:32 oz (Quart)| Color:Ivory Tower 02 - Antique WhiteRenaissance Furniture Paint was designed with you, your family and the environment’s safety in mind. Made of only the highest quality ingredients, Renaissance has Zero VOC’s (Volatile Organic Compounds) and zero emissions. There is no CA Prop 65 warning on this can. This paint does not have the dangerous chemicals that require such a warning! All this with the incredible coverage that usually only takes one to two coats! It's an easy to apply, 100% acrylic coating in a chalky smooth finish with excellent hide and durability. Versatile enough for distressed old world as well as high gloss contemporary styles, Renaissance is specifically designed for wood furniture and cabinets as well as an excellent choice for new or previously painted wallboard, plaster, interior masonry, metal or glass. • Non Toxic • Thick, even self-leveling coverage • Dries in 20 minutes • Durable finish that passes the fingernail scratch test • Silky chalky finish that is smooth to the touch • No surface prep required on a clean surface • Virtually no odor • Hypoallergenic • Manufactured in the USA • No sanding or priming required HOW-TO VIDEOS, LIVE SUPPORT AND INSTRUCTIONS You won't have to tackle that project alone. • How-to videos for every type of project can be found on the manufacturer's website. • Live online help offered through the manufacturer's fb page • Instructions included with every quart or kit purchased
feature_bullets: Non-toxic, zero VOC’s, Safe to use indoors.
Specifically designed for furniture and cabinets.
Great for shabby chic, vintage or contemporary styles

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,416 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
